snippet: Xi Jinping, the new head of the Communist Party, appears to be tapping more deeply into the idea of a national revival than his recent predecessors did.
abstract: News analysis; Xi Jinping, China's new Communist Party chief, appears to be tapping more deeply into the idea of national revival than his recent predecessors did; speaks of 'Chinese dream,' signaling strong nationalist leanings in speech in Shenzhen, on trip that shows intention to make reform a priority.
lead_paragraph: Xi Jinping, the new head of the Communist Party, appears to be tapping more deeply into the idea of a national revival than his recent predecessors did.

headline.seo: Signals of a More Open Economy in China
headline.main: Signals of a More Open Economy in China
headline.print_headline: Signals in China of a More Open Economy
